activity_name: Category 1: Community
Develop Your Brand Identity and Positioning
blurb: A well-defined brand clearly communicates your values, mission, and unique value proposition, making it easier for your target audience to understand how they might engage with your solution.

activity_name: Write and Speak about Your Innovation Publicly
blurb: Sharing your unique insights enhances your credibility as a thought leader and enriches the ecosystem's knowledge, attracting collaborators and supporters.

activity_name: Get Involved and Share with the Innovation Community
blurb: Getting involved and giving back to an innovation community can help you build a strong mutual support system with other innovators.

activity_name: Participate Actively in Your Community of Impact
blurb: Your community of impact—those directly affected by the problem you're tackling—is one of the most important groups you will need to engage with throughout the life of your venture.

activity_name: Form Mutually Beneficial Collaborations with Other Companies
blurb: Collaborating with companies that share your venture's vision can drive innovation through thought partnership, resource sharing, and market access.

activity_name: Connect with Like-Minded Companies in Your Space
blurb: Connecting with like-minded companies is foundational in creating a peer network of founders and businesses that are invested in learning and supporting one another.

activity_name: Identify Innovator Support Organizations That Can Help You Grow
blurb: Innovator support organizations (ISOs) are groups that train, connect, and sometimes fund innovators.

activity_name: Connect with Experts, Mentors, and Partners in Your Area of Impact
blurb: Connecting with experts, mentors, and partners in your area of impact can help you navigate complex challenges and accelerate your progress.

activity_name: Category 2: Entrepreneurship
Learn about the Innovation Funding Landscape
blurb: Understanding the funding landscape can help you make informed decisions about funding your business, including optimizing fundraising strategies, negotiating more favorable terms with funders, and creating a sustainable financial strategy for the future.

activity_name: Identify Funders That Share Your Values
blurb: Finding funders who align with your business's purpose and values ensures shared vision and strong mutual commitment.

activity_name: Practice Clear and Persuasive Communication
blurb: Effective communication helps you clearly express your mission and values, making it easier to attract and connect with partners, funders, and candidates who share your goals.

activity_name: Set up and Engage an Advisory Board
blurb: An advisory board is a group of outside experts who provide strategic advice, guidance, and support to a venture's team and founders.

activity_name: Reflect on Your Leadership Style and Goals
blurb: By understanding and developing your unique leadership style, you will be more equipped to navigate challenges, make difficult decisions, and guide your startup through various stages of growth while staying true to your business's core values and principles.

activity_name: Practice Telling Your Story
blurb: A compelling narrative builds confidence in your mission, helps you connect with potential partners, funders, and talent, and establishes your unique place in the innovation ecosystem.

activity_name: Learn How to Identify Skill Gaps and Fill Them
blurb: Identifying skill gaps and knowing how to fill them enables you to build a well-rounded, capable team that can tackle diverse challenges.

activity_name: Develop a Library of Useful Templates and Tools
blurb: A comprehensive resource library equipped with templates, tools, and reference materials can boost your team's efficiency by supporting the rapid onboarding of new hires, establishing professional standards, ensuring quality control, and encouraging knowledge sharing.

activity_name: Learn about Product Development Best Practices
blurb: While every venture faces unique challenges, there are many tried and true methods and best practices.

activity_name: Build and Refine Your Business Model
blurb: A business model is a framework that describes how a company creates, delivers, and captures value.

activity_name: Create Your Business Strategy with Your Team
blurb: A business strategy is a high-level approach that outlines how a company will achieve its long-term goals and stand out among competition in the market.

activity_name: Create a Company Wellbeing Strategy
blurb: Practicing wellbeing proactively at work is essential to running a sustainable business.

activity_name: Develop a Summary of Your Revenue, Costs, and Expenses
blurb: A profit and loss (P&L) statement provides a picture of your venture's financial health and performance during a specific period of time.

activity_name: Protect the Intellectual Property of Your Business
blurb: Securing your intellectual property (IP) allows you to safeguard your unique ideas, inventions, and creations from unauthorized use or replication.

activity_name: Acquire Necessary Equipment and Materials
blurb: Identifying and acquiring the foundational equipment and materials for your venture is a vital step in getting a business off the ground and operational.

activity_name: Register Your Business as a Legal Entity
blurb: Registering your business as a legal entity helps to legitimize your venture, protect your personal assets, and meet practical needs such as liability protection and paying taxes.

activity_name: Category 3: Impact
Define the Unique Value Proposition
blurb: A value proposition is a short statement that explains the unique benefits of your product or service to a target audience.

activity_name: Select a Name for Your Business
blurb: A clear and memorable name for your venture will go a long way in helping customers easily recognize your business and building brand loyalty.

activity_name: Conduct Competitive Analysis and Define Key Differentiators
blurb: A competitive analysis is a method for evaluating how well your venture and the products or services you offer will perform compared to other ventures providing similar products or services.

activity_name: Define a Unique Approach to Solving the Problem
blurb: To provide value, your venture needs to define a unique approach to solving a specific problem that matters.

activity_name: Map Out Stakeholders
blurb: A stakeholder map is a visual representation of all the people, organizations, and entities impacted by the problem you seek to solve.

activity_name: Sketch Out Your Theory of Change
blurb: A theory of change is a structured framework for how a set of assumptions and actions can lead to a set of anticipated outcomes.

activity_name: Define a Vision and Purpose for the Innovation
blurb: Defining a clear vision and purpose for a business provides a guiding north star, aligning all efforts and decisions towards a common goal while inspiring both team members and relevant groups.

activity_name: Fall in Love with a Problem
blurb: A deep-seated concern for a specific problem and the drive to solve it are the bedrock of innovation.

activity_name: Develop and Fine-Tune Your Elevator Pitch
blurb: An elevator pitch is a brief, persuasive speech you can use to spark interest among funders and investors in your venture and communicate how your venture provides value to your target audience.

activity_name: Build and Iterate on Your Minimum Viable Product
blurb: A minimum viable product (MVP) is a preliminary version of a product with a limited set of key features that can be used by early customers to provide feedback for future product development.

activity_name: Conduct Secondary Research
blurb: Conducting comprehensive secondary research, or desk research, ensures that your innovation builds upon existing knowledge and targets areas that have not already been reached, allowing you stand out among competitors.

activity_name: Develop a Plan for Proving Your Impact
blurb: Giving evidence of impact means proving your innovation actually delivers on its promises, showing real results instead of just good intentions.

activity_name: Interview Relevant People Relentlessly
blurb: Making the space and time to interview people—whether that's your target audience, funders, investors, community leaders, or subject-matter experts—ensures that you stay in touch with their needs, preferences, and pain points.

activity_name: Track Your Assumptions and Pivots
blurb: Tracking your assumptions and pivots can help you learn from your decisions, stay flexible, and respond quickly to new information.

activity_name: Identify the Core Values That Drive Your Work
blurb: Defining your venture's core values can shape your venture's culture, decision-making processes, and overall direction.

activity_name: Set up Internal Systems for Collaboration
blurb: Creating streamlined collaboration systems is vital for launching and scaling your business, as these systems promote transparency and ensure that your team knows where, when, and how they can work together towards shared goals—ultimately boosting their productivity.
